Text: Uhmmm....Can 5.1 videos be played on 2.0 sound system?

@Guizin239
Of course. Though it wouldn't sound as good. You can always use a video player to downmix the audio track to 2.0 Stereo.

In VLC, open the video, right-click on the screen, go to "Audio," then "Audio Devices" and select "Stereo."

In Media Player Classic, open the video and right-click on the screen, go to "Audio," then "Options" and make sure "Enable Custom Channel Mapping" is enabled, and make sure "Input Channels" is set to "2." Then click "Apply."

Yes, you're right. PS3 Media Server has that option, and if you want to watch on an Xbox using PS3 Media Server, you NEED to downmix to 2.0 Stereo since Xbox does not support 5 channels and will not play the file.
